output.conclusion: This course provides a solid foundation in machine design principles, enabling you to analyze, design, and optimize mechanical components and systems. You are now equipped to tackle real-world engineering challenges with confidence.
output.introduction: Welcome to Machine Design! This intermediate-level course builds upon fundamental engineering principles to provide a comprehensive understanding of the design process for machines and mechanical components. We will cover topics ranging from material selection and stress analysis to failure theories and design optimization.

chapters.description: Overview of the machine design process, design considerations (function, strength, cost, reliability), engineering ethics, and the role of codes and standards.

Review of material properties (strength, stiffness, toughness, fatigue resistance), material selection charts, common engineering materials (metals, polymers, ceramics, composites), and material processing methods.
Review of stress and strain concepts, stress concentration factors, stress transformation, principal stresses, Mohr's circle, and introduction to finite element analysis (FEA).
Introduction to different failure theories (Maximum Shear Stress Theory, Distortion Energy Theory, Modified Mohr Theory), application of failure theories to design, and safety factors.
S-N curves, fatigue life estimation, factors affecting fatigue life (surface finish, stress concentration, mean stress), fatigue strength reduction factor, and design for infinite life.
Shaft design considerations (torque transmission, bending moments, axial loads), stress analysis of shafts, critical speed of shafts, and shaft materials.
Types of bolted joints, preload, bolt materials, bolt strength, joint stiffness, fatigue loading of bolted joints, and design considerations for bolted connections.
Types of welded joints, weld symbols, weld strength, stress concentration in welds, fatigue loading of welded joints, and design considerations for welded connections.
Introduction to optimization techniques, design variables, objective functions, constraints, optimization algorithms, and application of optimization to machine design problems.
